about_the_game:
Your goal is to set up an efficient rail network that keeps your passengers happy and on-time


This is the demo for Iron Roads, a top-down 2D train management game in which you lay tracks, buy trains, and set their routes until you have an efficient network carrying passengers and cargo between your towns and factories. Run your enterprise efficiently while avoiding backlogs, jams, bankruptcy, and angry passengers, and you'll be recognised for the unsung train hero you know you are.

Download and play the demo now!


The demo is a slice of the game that will arrive in Early Access in January 2025. You can play the entire first scenario, or try your luck for a spot on the high score board in challenge mode. Give it a go and let us know what you liked, what you didn't and what you think we could change.

Who are your passengers?


The humans have been wiped off the face of the planet. The other animals survived and thrived, but have been too afraid to leave their towns.

Here’s where you come in.

Set up train networks connecting towns and industries and see the new civilisation grow and thrive.

Things you can do in the Iron Roads demo


Keep passengers happy Set up a fast transport network that will get your erudite animal passengers to their destination on time

Research Unlock new trains, technologies, and things to transport

Carry cargo Transport goods efficiently in interconnected production chains

Enjoy a minimalistic interface It is easy to learn, but that allows for many happy hours optimising and building your networks

Listen to the sound of your network Music in Iron Roads is a combination of notes generated from your trains and passengers, and authored melodies. The music you hear will be as unique as the layouts you build

Accept contracts Scenarios come with a grant system where you can follow focussed goals if you wish to earn extra money and get the satisfaction of ticking off a to-do list

Performance graphs The main goal of Iron Roads is to optimise your network, so you may wish to use the charts to analyse data relating to your finances and passengers

Build large, complex networks Or small-to-medium sized networks, if that's what floats your boat

Features we plan to add to Iron Roads during Early Access


This is far from a complete list, but some of the more commonly requested features on our roadmap:

  • Further content: Iron Roads already has a number of hand-crafted scenarios, timed challenges and an sandbox mode, but we plan to expand each during Early Access
  • Multiplayer
  • Mod support
  • Weather events that will test the resilience of your network

Iron Roads will not have

  • Buses, boats, planes or any other form of transport
  • 3D graphics: our focus is on allowing you to build large networks easily, and we find 2D better for that
  • NFTs, lootboxes or microtransactions

Games we were inspired by

  • OpenTTD
  • Mini Metro
  • Two Point Hospital
  • Lets Build a Zoo
  • Opus Magnum

Iron Roads is being developed by a BAFTA-nominated husband-and-wife team, Marina and Duncan. You can find out more about us and our work on our website.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 20.04, Debian 12 (requires glibc 2.35 or higher)
  • Processor: 1 GHz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Open GL 3.1+
  • Storage: 128 MB available space
  • Sound Card: N/A

name: Iron Roads Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7
  • Processor: 1 GHz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Open GL 3.1+
  • Storage: 128 MB available space
  • Sound Card: N/A
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Lay tracks, buy trains, set their routes. Optimise your network and repeat till dawn. Run your enterprise efficiently while avoiding backlogs, jams, bankruptcy or angry passengers, and you'll be recognised for the unsung train hero you know you are. Download the demo now!
